node.statement: Answer: YES, the measures are equivalent. Proof strategy: We construct an explicit Radon-Nikodym derivative d(T_psi* mu)/d(mu) using UV regularization. The proof has four stages: (A) compute the RN derivative for regularized measures mu_eps via Wick calculus, (B) identify the renormalized limit as eps -> 0 by separating convergent Wick-power terms from the divergent mass-counterterm contribution, (C) establish L^1(mu) integrability of the limit using sub-Gaussian tail estimates for the Phi^4_3 measure, and (D) conclude mutual absolute continuity by symmetry (psi -> -psi). The key insight is that the interaction difference V(phi+psi)-V(phi) involves only lower-order Wick powers smeared against smooth functions of psi, requiring no new UV renormalization beyond the mass counterterm already present in the construction of mu.
